{{also|obst}} ==German== ===Etymology=== * From {{inh|de|gmh|obez}}, from {{inh|de|goh|obez}}, {{m|goh|obaz||fruit}}, from {{der|de|gem-pro|*ubatją|t=fruit, produce, increase}}, from a compound whose first element represents {{der|de|ine-pro|*obʰi-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*ebʰi-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*bʰi-|t=on, toward, from, by}}, and whose second element is {{der|de|gem-pro|*at}}, {{m|gem-pro|*ēta-|t=edibles, food}}, from {{der|de|gem-pro|*etaną||t=to eat}}, from {{der|de|ine-pro|*h₁ed-|t=to eat}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|ovest|t=mast}}, {{cog|gml|ōvet}}, {{m|gml|āvet}}, {{m|gml|ōft||t=fruit}}, {{cog|nds-de|Aaft||fruits}}, {{cog|nl|ooft||fruits}}. More at {{l|en|ovest}}. * The drug sense likely derives from cocaine being smuggled through ports in fruit crates. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/oːpst/}} * {{audio|de|De-Obst.ogg|audio}} ===Noun=== {{de-noun|n|Obstes|gen2=Obsts|-}} # Edible plant parts, other than nuts, which are mainly eaten with sweet dishes, primarily [[fruit]] and [[berry|berries]]. Edible parts of plants which do not count as [[vegetables]]. #: {{ux|de|Heute esse ich nur '''Obst'''.|t=Today I only eat '''fruit'''.|inline=1}} # {{label|de|slang}} [[cocaine]] #* {{quote-song|de|date=2018-07-12|artist=Moe Phoenix, Gringo, Maxwell 187 & Laruzo|lyricist=Maxwell|title=Wake Up|passage=150 Gramm '''Obst''' in 'ner Woche einfach weggekifft –
Nenn es Hochleistungssport!
Leg paar Lines auf’n Tisch, knall das Koks durch das Rohr!|translation=150 grams of '''fruits''' just toked away in a week –
Call it high-performance sport!
Lay some lines on the table, blow the coke through the pipe!}} #* {{quote-journal|de|last=Biermann|first=Til|url=https://www.bz-berlin.de/berlin/dreister-kokain-verkauf-per-obst-lieferservice-visitenkarte|work=B.Z.|title={{lang|ar|Dreister Kokain-Verkauf per „Obst Lieferservice“-Visitenkarte}}|date=2019-01-30|passage=Ein Mann kommt auf den B.Z.-Reporter zu. „Kokain?“, fragt er, drückt Visitenkarten in die Hand und geht. „Alex Obst – '''Obst''' & Gemüse Lieferservice“, steht da. „'''Obst'''“, das steht für „Koks“. […] Wir sagen, dass wir gerne '''Obst''' kaufen würden, das wird ja auf der Visitenkarte angeboten. […] Wir: „Was sind denn so die Preise, oder besprechen wir das dann?“ Der Mann: „0,5 – 50 Euro.“ Also 100 Euro pro Gramm, 100.000 Euro pro Kilo.|translation=A man appoaches the [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Berliner_Zeitung B.Z.] reporter. „Cocaine?“, he asks, puts business cards in my hand and leaves. „Alex Obst – '''Fruits''' & Vegetables Delivery“, it says. „'''fruits'''“, that means „cocaine“. […] We say that we would like to buy '''fruits''', as offered on the business card. […] We: „So what are the prices? Or will we talk about that later?“ The man: „0,5 – 50 Euro.“ That means, 100 Euro a gram, 100,000 Euro a kilogram.}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|Gemüse}}; {{l|de|Nuss}} ====Hypernyms==== * {{l|de|Frucht}} ====Derived terms==== {{der3|de |Einmachobst |Fallobst |Obstbaum |Obstessig |Obstfliege |Obstgarten |Obstgabel |Obstglas |Obstgeschäft |Obsthandel |Obsthändler |Obstkeller |Obstkiste |Obstler |Obstmesser |Obstkuchen |Obstregal |Obstsalat |Obstsorten |Obststand |Obstschale |Obstteller |Obstwiese }} ===Further reading=== * {{R:DWDS}} * {{R:Duden}} {{topics|de|Recreational drugs}}
